column1: That there near some that in their privacy

And near the castle such there dwelt three.

But it were with the eye of their mind
With which men see

column1: OED - Oxford English Dictionary (OED) http:/dictionary.oed.com/entrance.dtl ";"But yet nere Cristene Britons so exiled

Honoured Crist and hethen folk bigiled

But it were with thilke eyen of his mynde

column1: Capitol; Brutus killed me.;"provisional";"William Shakespeare";"Julius Caesar";"Shakespeare
Stay not to answer me
Why dost thou stay?
[Lucius:] To know my errand
[Portia:] I would have had thee there and here again
Ere I can tell thee what thou shouldst do there.
(Aside) O constancy
Set a huge mountain ’tween my heart and tongue.
I have a man’s mind but a woman’s might.
How hard it is for women to keep counsel! -
Art thou here yet?
[Lucius:] Madam
Run to the Capitol
And so return to you
[Portia:] Yes
For he went sickly forth. And take good note
What Caesar doth
Hark
[Lucius:] I hear none
[Portia:] Prithee
I heard a bustling rumor like a fray
And the wind brings it from the Capitol.
[Lucius:] Sooth

column1: There is much matter to be heard and learned.
(To Duke) You to your former honour I bequeath;
Your patience and your virtue well deserves it.
(To Orlando) You to a love that your true faith doth
merit.
(To Oliver) You to your land
allies.
(To Silvius) You to a long and well-deservèd bed.
(To Touchstone) And you to wrangling
loving voyage
Is but for two months victualled. - So to your
pleasures.
I am for other than for dancing measures.
[Duke Senior:] Stay
[Jaques:] To see no pastime
I'll stay to know at your abandoned cave.

May make too great an act. For learn this
Better to leave undone than by our deed
Acquire too high a fame when him we serve 's away. [...]
